Key Arguments: The Draft Bill infringes on democratic rights to free speech.
ACMA, an unelected body, should not have the power to decide what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
The Bill could lead to self-censorship by social media companies to align with government agendas.
Government and mainstream media are exempt from the Bill, which could lead to biased information dissemination.
Free speech should only be limited in extreme cases like hate speech or incitement to violence.
Open debate is essential for democracy and should not be stifled by legislation.
Notable Quotes: The Draft Bill potentially tramples all over our democratic right to free speech just to meet vague notions of harm and serious harm.
I am appalled with the idea of having an unelected bureaucratâ€™s opinion to be the arbiter on any opinion that I should choose to express online.
Misinformation is not a threat to our democracy. The real threat to our democratic values is this Draft Bill should it become legislated.
